interfaces

Interface IAfterAction

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AfterAction

    public interface IAfterAction
    IAfterAction is a way to perform an Action Keywords a given number of times until the expected outcome is achieved. If the expected outcome is never present, then an exception is finally thrown The purpose of this is that in some scenarios Selenium performs an action but due to some executing javascript or other reason the given action is not actually rendered byt the browser This can often be due to timing of scripts or behavior in the browser
    Author:
    Mathew Carrigan

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      ActionKeyword getAction()
      Returns the action that was performed in order to evaluate if the expected condition was met.
      IAfterAction that(java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Boolean> condition)
      That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the Callable condition is met or the timeout is met
      IAfterAction that(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Boolean> condition)
      That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the Predicate condition is met or the timeout is met
      IAfterAction that(WaitKeyword wait)
      That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the WaitKeyword return is true or the timeout is met

    • Method Detail

      • that

        IAfterAction that(java.util.function.Predicate<java.lang.Boolean> condition)
        That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the Predicate condition is met or the timeout is met
        Parameters:
        condition - Predicate to be evaluated
        Returns:
        IAfterAction for method chaining purposes and to be able to have multiple conditions to be met

      • that

        IAfterAction that(java.util.concurrent.Callable<java.lang.Boolean> condition)
        That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the Callable condition is met or the timeout is met
        Parameters:
        condition - Callable to returned and evaluated
        Returns:
        IAfterAction for method chaining purposes and to be able to have multiple conditions to be met

      • that

        IAfterAction that(WaitKeyword wait)
        That represents the expected outcome and the action will be repeated until either the WaitKeyword return is true or the timeout is met
        Parameters:
        wait - WaitKeyword to be executed and evaulated. WaitKeywords all return true or false depending on if the wait condition was met
        Returns:
        IAfterAction for method chaining purposes and to be able to have multiple conditions to be met

      • getAction

        ActionKeyword getAction()
        Returns the action that was performed in order to evaluate if the expected condition was met. This action gets repeated until either the condition is met or the timeout occurs
        Returns:
        ActionKeyword's action event to execute
